ETYMOLOGY: Coined by Werner Buchholz in 1956 during the early design phase for the IBM Stretch computer. It is a modification of 'bit' (binary digit) and 'bite', chosen to avoid accidental spelling errors and to signify a small chunk of data. Originally, a byte was a variable-sized string of bits, but later standardized to eight bits.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A unit of digital information that most commonly consists of eight bits, used to encode a single character of text in many computer architectures.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种数字信息单位，通常由八个二进制位（比特）组成，在许多计算机体系结构中用于编码单个文本字符。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Modern hard drives can store terabytes of data, meaning trillions of bytes.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 现代硬盘可以存储数万亿字节的数据，意味着数万亿个字节。
